risk_factors: Young adult males have statistically higher recidivism rates
One arrest without conviction suggests lower severity but some criminal history
4 jobs in one year indicates significant instability
Recent history of multiple drug use is a strong predictor
Reported depression symptoms indicate psychological vulnerability
GED but no further education suggests limited career prospects
Living alone with no marriage history may indicate weak social support
Large household in urban area is a minor risk factor
Faith can be a protective factor against recidivism

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 2 inches and weighs 215 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 4 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 5, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
